intro: Tritonia anigozanthiflora, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that open in the morning and close in the evening. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its vines can grow up to several meters in length. Tritonia anigozanthiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
